result.execSummary:
Michael G Rafuse was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Michael G Rafuse was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael G Rafuse

defendant.name: Rafuse, Michael G
defendant.address: Jefferson Co Jail 411 S. Center Ave, Jefferson, WI 53549

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called 1:15 pm
Defendant Michael G Rafuse in court, in custody with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews that it was informed prior to taking the bench that the defendant was going to consent to extradition.
Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that that is correct.
Court reviews with the defendant his rights to habeas corpus.
Attorney Zarwell believes the defendant is making a knowingly, voluntarily decision to waive extradition.

Court observes the defendant sign the waiver of extradition.
Court endorses the Waiver of Extradition.
Court will leave to defense counsel to follow-up with the Court if the defendant is not extradited within a reasonable time frame.

recess: 1:24 pm
